page.title: 04LITTLE HORKESLEY HALL
page.content: The hall,once the manor house of Lt.Horkesley has been demolished and rebuilt several times since its Saxon beginnings.Major General De Hainlland now lives in the hall,although his deceased wifes family,the otter_Barrys,still have possession.The building,once grand,is in need of some repair and many of the rooms are closed as only one person lives there. The garden once beautiful and well kept is gradually being taken over by weeds and horses.Two oak trees remain at the side of the house,evidence that once the road ran through an avenue of oak trees to the front of the Church. A previous owner of the hall felled the trees and re_routed the road because he felt that it was to close to the house.
